column5: Hurry up and go !Â  Â Any questions shoot me a message
Amazing!
Wow - looks like a great trip. Â thanks for sharing !

After a few years offÂ  we trecked north on our pilgrimage for monster Brookies.Â  Fuel prices be dammed.Â  Â Arrived to find Temps and weather aboutÂ  week ahead of when we usualy arriveÂ  I have never seen Temps in the 50's while fishing here.Â  Water was also up a foot or two . No monsters this year but lots of goodÂ  fish to keep us busy all species were fairly cooperative throughout the week.Â  The brookies were off a little with the warmer Temps realy had to work for em compared to water Temps in the in the 30's and 40'sÂ  .Â  The Lakers were unlimited in supply and a blast in 6-10 fow on lighter spinning gear, couldn't hookup with the big ones were we have had luck in the past down deeper.Â  Pike were in super skinny water and super aggressive on top water at times making fishing fun but resulting in more dropped fish than hookups. 24" Brookie 44" Pike andÂ  32" Laketrout being the best for the week.Â  Â Great week to disconnect and recharge with 3 of my best friends and my Dad Pretty sure we took a 14 ft boat where no 14 ft boat has ever been on this trip for those who know the lake we had 3 days of glass and made the most of it with some runs up to 30km each way. However the small boat was never out of sight from the big boat when too far from camp. Enough of me talking here's some pics .
